page.title: 09HOUSES AND HOMES.
page.content: Our houses are normally one or two storeys high. They are made of bricks or stone with a roof of tile or slate and very few are thatched. Almost all the houses in Fotheringhay are made of stone with a roof of either slate or thatch. People usually have 2 or 3 bedrooms, a dining room, a lounge, a bathroom and a kitchen. In the bedrooms there are beds, wardrobes, (sometimes built-in) and a dressing table. In the bathroom there is a bath, hand basin and w.c. Sometimes there is a separate room for the w.c. In the dining room there is a sideboard, a dining table and chairs. In the kitchen there is a cooker, sink, refrigerator, washing machine, wastebin and cupboards. In the lounge there are easy chairs. People usually watch the television there. Written by Michelle Daniel
